title: New: Mutual Benefit – Auburn Epitaphs
body:
Artwork by **[Alex Porter](http://www.flickr.com/photos/46873084@N03/)**

Following their 12” release with [Holy Spirits](http://www.facebook.com/holyspiritsband) on **[Father/Daugher Records](http://fatherdaughterrecords.com/)**, [Mutual Benefit](http://www.facebook.com/mutualbenefit) have been going from strength to strength. From the groups’ New York launch party, to the records blog-studded cast, the blogosphere really has a lot to talk about when it comes to Mutual Benefit. Their new single is due to be released on **[Kassette Klub](http://www.facebook.com/kassetteklub)**, and also features an experimental track by **Philip Seymour Hoffman**, a track **Mutual Benefit** easily outshine.

The track, **_Auburn Epitaphs_**, is a committed and charming folk gem. It floats with a graceful and sparse sensibility, sounds echoing and bouncing in the angelic yet cavernous space. In terms of genre, it sits gently between folk and benign surf-pop, yet as with all **Mutual Benefit** releases, it’s better to relax and just let the music transport you. Which is exactly what I’m planning to do.

Stream and D/L the tracks below.
